section.para: This extension allows to configure the commercial encryption features of DMR. Almost all DMR radios implement means for encrypting the traffic. This feature however, is usually illegal when used within a amateur radio context.

example.programlisting: encryption: keys: - dmr: id: key1 name: Example key 1 key: ABCD - aes: id: key2 name: Example key 2 key: 01234567890123456789012345678901

section.para: As extensions cannot be lists, the encryption extension is a mapping, that contains a single element named keys. This element is then the list of all defined keys. Each key must either be a DMR (basic) or AES (enhanced) key.

The former defines a simple 16bit key while the latter defines a 126bit AES key. To differentiate these key types, each list entry must be a mapping with a single entry. The name specifies the type (i.e., either dmr or aes). The value then specifies the properties of the key.
As only the size differs between the different key types, there are common attributes. Specifically, the ID and name of the key.

listitem.para: Specifies the ID of the key. This ID can then be used to reference the key within the commercial digital channel extension. See .
Specifies the name of the key. This property is usually not encoded in the binary codeplug.
Specifies the 16bit key as a HEX string. To this end, a 4-char hex string is specified.
Specifies the 128bit key as a HEX string. To this end, a 32-char hex string is specified.
